review_title: Great place to work for me.
pros: Great place to work, everyone is very helpful!
cons: Time due to my full time job

review_title: You cannot live on the salary, so you have to work more than one job.
pros: The small class sizes and the students.
cons: Complete chaos and no one appreciates your hard work or credentials. Not upward mobility. No protection because the union is no longer recognized. Worked on probation for three years for continuing contact. Got a raise after six years of no raises, but it was only 7% with inflation at over 9% and no COLA ever. Even if you apply for promotion and tenure it may not be granted and it is only a 1% raise for the work of putting together an extensive dossier.
The administration is scamming tax payers

review_title: Edward Waters College, a wholesome place to work.
pros: One of the pros of working at Edward Waters College is the College's Culture & Values. Edward Waters College believes in giving everyone a chance to improve the quality of their lives through education. The staff help reflect this idea by taking a personal interest in the lives and well-being of its student body.
cons: One con of working at Edward Waters College is the student body. A small percentage of the student body does not have the willingness to learn the material given in class.

pros: Challenging, rewarding. Most students are there to learn.
cons: Faculty meetings are demeaning most of the time. What should be said in private to an individual is voiced to all. Lowers morale.

job_title: Developmetal English Instructor in Jacksonville, FL
pros: The staff and co-workers were supportive.  The majority of students  were prepared mentally for college.
cons: A few other students weren't, and wanted extra time to turn in assignments. They didn't want to take responsibility  to read the Syllabus  and acted like high school students,

review_title: Atrocious Working Enviroment and Upper Management
job_title: Student Accounts Coordinator in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Some staff really care about the students, no cost parking, cafeteria is AMAZING with a plethora of options at a reasonable price.
cons: Malicious and Condescending  staff in the business office- it's a clique not a professional atmosphere. Upper management does not listen to employees therefore causing more work than is necessary. Inadequate training for software. Completely takes advantage of salaried employees by expecting them to essentially be on call for every event (with almost no notice) to help on & off campus despite it not being in their job description. Team player to them means shutting your mouth, going along with "the program" even if it is to the determent to the students and borderline illegal.  Students were delayed or mislead in regards to their accounts and when asked for clarification was pushed aside. Within the time I was employed there several employees either quit or got let go & we nearly all had something in common - We pushed for accountability and we knew our areas of expertise. To top it off: Inadequate safety measures in place for staff in regards to Covid-19. Do not work there! Do not waste your education, energy, or professionalism by working at EWC.

dishonest administrators, weak department heads, college is about 30 years behind most colleges, falsification of records is the norm, constantly enrolls ghost students to improve enrollment numbers every year, incompetence is the norm, administrators are incompetent and overly paid while facilities lack basic amenities, parking lots are in bad condition and not paved, hostile to white employees, always fires the best people

pros: Friendly staff of professionals  and co-workers.
cons: Too many activities for staff development that writing comonere too much like high school.

pros: I was able to complete my degree in 2 years.
cons: There were not any auxiliaries for Non traditional students.
Low pay, incompetent leaders, borderline crooks
